38 | Genesis 2024

ta Le

If you need a break from the urban jungle, the
deer park is where you should go. You can take a
leisurely walk around the park, looking at the
deer in the shade of the trees. Not far, you'll find
gossiping ducks in a majestic pond with beautiful
scenery full of greenery and the old Hauz Khas
Fort at its boundary. This is a great place to go for
a picnic with your friends, but make sure to keep
an eye on your photographer friend. (A slight
PSA: the water in the majestic pond doesn’t smell
divine)

SDA

Bored of the food of your hostel and want to eat
outside the campus, well SDA is a market just in
front of the main gate which offers a wide range
of local and exotic cuisines in the form of fast
foods, chaat, etc., in various stalls, cafés, and
restaurants. After completing quizzes, minors, or
majors, you can chill here with all your friends.

  

PA 4 GAR \c) 5

A place where you can feel like partying in the
1300s. It is currently known for its vibrant club
culture and nightlife with numerous cafés, bars
and clubs, along with the ruins of the medieval
period. Other than that, it has numerous boutiques
and art galleries with both local and exotic
products.

It also has a 13th-century fort which will
make you feel like you are in medieval times.

Places (0 explore around Delhi

 

Genesis 2024 | 39

 

 

ye) CAN

The Lajpat Nagar Market should be a must-visit
destination if shopping gives you joy and more so
if you’re a shopper looking to add to your ethnic
wear collection! Its wide collection of stores
means there’s something here for everyone. But,
remember to exercise your bargaining skills when
needed to snatch up your favourite pieces at
prices that won’t dent your wallets.

  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
   
 
  
 

INCOM Ca da

Imagine a wondrous land where fashion
dreams come true on a budget and where
you can come out with bags full of clothes
and a smiling wallet. But beware of reading
the brand names correctly to not to confuse
‘Gucchi' with ‘Gucci. Remember, when
shopping in Sarojini, leave no blouse
unturned and no bargain unclaimed.

OLD DELHI

OR, to put it in better words “Purani Dilli”. If

Delhi's glitzy malls and high-end restaurants

don’t excite you, don’t worry! A walk around
Purani Dilli is all you need!

Savour the taste of typical Indian street food
“chaat” in the lanes of Chandni Chowk, or take
a stroll around Qutub Minar.

If you are looking for a quiet place to sit while
talking to your travel mates, Agrasen ki Baoli is
the place for you. Have a humbling experience
in Delhi and visit Purani Dilli. Lal Qila Metro
Station is the nearest to Chandni Chowk.

If you’re someone who loves dressing up, your
“jhumkas” will be a cherry on top for your visit.

The best time to go there is winter.

—————

Situated in GTB Nagar, this lane is famous for
its aesthetically appealing cafes that serve
the tastiest and craziest varieties of dishes.
Grab your foodie friends and hit the lane!

HUMAYUN’S TOMB

While the tombs here are akin to the
ones at Lodhi Gardens, the small crowds
here make it a perfect place for a visit.
So, bring a friend or two and enjoy the
beauty the Mughals left for us!

LODHI GARDENS

A small walk from the Jor Bagh metro
station, the Lodhi Gardens _ offer
everything from touristy photo spots to
picnic spots and scenic trails.

Plan a trip
to Lodhi Gardens when you want to have
a fun and relaxed evening with friends or

capture nature at its finest.

|LINCEPTION |=

\@ Introductory Freshers’ Magazine

 

Bi

Introductory Fresher’s Magazine

INCEPTION

VOL 11 | 2023-24

@

 

A large compendium of mock tests, calculus problems and chemical
reactions has finally, FINALLY, gotten you into the magical realms of this
institution. Heartiest congratulations! Welcome to an overwhelmingly diverse,
messy and amazing family. Board for Student Publications

    

ie:

We expect that you have already suffered from an incessant bout of long and dull orientations- so
we'll skip the frivolities and keep it short. The Board for Student Publications (in short, BSP) is the
official media and journalism body of IIT Delhi, which means that we gauge and share both
information and insights on a broad spectrum of subjects, ranging from the humane lives of demonic
professors to the state of infrastructure on campus. Inception is the first magazine that we publish
every academic year, and we like to think of it as a comprehensive literary version of Dumbledore's
speech to the first-years at Hogwarts; a welcoming bouquet of words imbued with warmth, sagacity,
and most importantly, hope.

A team of 60+ spirited writers, designers and editors have risen to the occasion and pieced together
a vivid medley of thoughts, emotions and experiences to guide you through your inception at IIT-D,
both the ecstasies and the disappointments, the successes and the failures, the predictable and the
unpredictable. Life at IIT-D presents itself as an open ocean of infinite choices and possibilities, and
change, whilst terrifying, can also be exhilarating. The process of putting down to words all the things
we have learnt and felt here has been extremely close to our hearts, and we hope that this edition of
Inception resonates with you, embraces you, and reminds you that this family is always here for you.

Best Wishes,
Chief Editors, Content- Aanya Khurana, Abhinav Anwesha Mohanty, Maathangi Anirudh
Chief Editors, Design- Harshit Garg, Shreya Gupta

Special Thanks

Prof.

Gaurav Goel, President, BSP

sara Roshen, General Secretary, BSP

Nikhil Gupta, Deputy General Secretary, BSP

Content Team: Aahna Jain, Aarushi Mittal, Abhinav Srivastav, Akshay Raj, Amaan Ali Sayed, Ananya
Agarwal, Aneeket Yadav, Aryan Bhardwaj, Aryan Jindal, Eshita, Gourab Raj Sabat, Harshit Goyal, Janki
Insan, Keshav Agarwal, Mansi Seth, Nikhil Gupta, Nishesh Agarwal, Rohil Jain, Sahil Grover, Sai,
Samarth, Shahid Khan, Shivi Sisodiya, Shourya Vir Jain, Shriom Kumar Singh, Soumya Thakur, Sriya
Mistry, Tushya, Yashika Gulati

Design Team: Anchal, Anupam Singh, Anurag Sen, Anushka Chaturvedi, Aryan Dharwa, Aryan Gupta
Dhruv Joshi, Harsh Khemka, Ishaan, Lakshya Kumar, Naina Jain, Nikhil Zawar, Preksha Mishra, Pritish,
Sandeep, Satvik Deep, Shreyash Pandey, Soumya Bhagat, Srijan Kumar, Srishti Nagpal

ee ee ne *

etter from the

_.... Director

Congratulations to your hard work and your excellent performance that has
got you here.

You are among the select few who made it to our 2023 batch.

 

At our institute, you will find an enabling academic environment, a flexible
curriculum, amazing peers and seniors and engaging and knowledgeable
faculty. The lectures, tutorials and class room interactions, laboratories,
assignments and tests will be a part of your academic journey. We provide an
opportunity for your all round development —- with excellent facilities for
sports, cultural and extra curriculum and co-curriculum. We have state of
the art research facilities, a well-equipped modern library and high-power
computing resources. Whatever be your interests and passion, you will find
others who share the excitement and can help.

Please approach your new environment with an open mind and make the most of
the opportunities on the campus. We are delighted to enable your journey of
learning. Please don’t hesitate to reach out to your friends, seniors,
wardens, faculty members whenever you need any help or advice.

I know many of you will be stepping out of your homes and your comfort zones.
You will find our campus a home away from home where we will make the extra

effort to help you settle in.

I am sure that these four years will be memorable and will be among the best
years of your life.

Prof. Rangan Banerjee
Director, IIT Delhi

7

 

05 | Inception 2023

Letter from the Dean

Dear Students,

Tt-is my pleasure to introduce you the Office of Dean, Student Affairs (ODSA), which
assists you in your own holistic development at IIT Delhi. On one hand, your purauit
of Academic excellence is guided by world class faculty through a state-of-the-art
academic curriculum. On the other hand, your quest for self-discovery and growth is
fuided by teams of students and faculty through various avenues via the ODGA.

TTD allows for nurturing your existing loutside-the-classroom) skills/hobbies
while creating ample opportunities for you.to explore new activities. Offering some
of the best sports facilities, TITD also maintains a vibrant culture of debates, music,
theatre/drama, dance, fine arts, photography, and literary activities amongst others.
All activities are managed by students themselves with faculty mentors, assisted by
dedicated and able staff.

The freedom you experience at IITD also comes with responsibility. Everyone is
expected to maintain A decorum, 80.

as not to disturb/offend others in the community
(students, staff and faculty, families), Being mindful of one’s own safety along with
safety and privacy of others in the campus (including hostels) is mandatory.
Following rules and regulations without seeking exceptions/reLlaxationsa: helps
maintain our integrity. In this regard, [ITD does not operate on decisions taken by
any One individual. Mechanisms exist in which students, faculty, and staff

collectively discuss and decide on various courses of action through various bodies.

Thus, it is important to appreciate/follow the systems and hierarchies;in place,

while amprovingp their. operations by addressing limitations through proper
processes.

The pandemic has unfortunately “reset” the campus life. However,
current batches have the-exciting opportunity to revive the
TITD ethos. E.g. bonds created in ITTD hostels resonate through
lifetimes. Starting with sharing of rooms, and learning how to
live/operate together in teams, hostel life plays a major role in
transforming students into responsible independent citizens of
India and the world. The cosmopolitan environment here
inculcates VALUES ef respect-without-prejudice and
unconditional tolerance that will serve you for life.

Finally, the whole IITD. system is geared

towards ensuring your mental and physical

well-being. Striving for personal

excellence, you need: to,be careful in not

petting swayed by what appears “cool” to

others — rather youjmust decide what is

“cool” for you. For this, the ODSA is fully

committed to meet your needs,.In case you.

need any help/support with non~academic/™

campus matters, please feel free to i

out to us. ai
i

Prof. Aditya Mittal
Dean of Student Affairs, LIT Deiha

ion 2023 | 06

 

   

     
  
  
 
 
  
  
 
    
  

. Sn I Ysywe finally achieved your dream.’ is a single thoughts ~
that dominates your mind as you set foot on the college campus for”
he first time. There is a spring in your step along with a tinge of
nervousness,

and rightly so, for it is the start of a journey, one of knowledge and
exploration.

And it isn't just your own, but that of many others, starting
at the same place, some of which will heavily influence yours.

As you navigate through the ups and downs, you will find yourself

Academics at IIT sharply contrasts with what you are used to until now.

It is rigorous and you are expected to focus on understanding and
original thinking. You will receive a wake-up call regarding this from your
8 (or your Ist APL quiz, if you are lucky). Evaluations are done
out the semester with quizzes, assignments, minors, and majors,
ngistency is the key to doing well. Contrary to your school life, you

you might feel that your results don't do justice to the effort you put in.
It is a feeling all of us go through at some point and makes us question
our abilities.
However, between enlightening discussions with your peers and all-
nighters before exams , these thoughts will wane and you will unlock the
| superpower of covering the entire syllabus in one night and giving
exams without sleeping a wink (Not a recommended path though).
Academics are your doorway to the various opportunities you receive
+ during college or after, and you really want them to stay open for you.

(a

a

~ at IIT may not be all fun and games, but there are many ways to
make it enjoyable. A big part of college life here is the variety of
Extracurricular activities it offers, from dance, drama, and photography
to literature, quizzing and many more. They've got you covered in all
aspects. Any activity you find interesting, you will find a group of

e people who are equally or even more interested in it. Going to club

~ workshops and participating in competitions is one of the best ways of

socialising, broadening your perspective and making long-lasting
friendships.

Some of the fondest memories of your college life will be made here, ~

e it your first dance performance or the first piece of poetry yo
itten.

i

07 | Inception 2023

  

 

MALT]; wun

  
  

  

  

Time flies during your college days, and it flies fast. S: imes, it might feel like
you are always playing catch-up. You will find yourself juggling quizzes,
assignment deadlines, club workshops and spending time with friends
simultaneously.

You are on your own now with no fixed routine of school life and
no one to guide you on how to use your time, which is of the essence here, and it
sses in the blink of an eye, so it should be utilised judiciously.

  
  
  
   
  
   
 
  

eve n if it means refusing your friends on some matters. Just hang in there, and
on you'll learn to squeeze out every second of the twenty-four hours and use

f you will be away from home for the first time. You'll find it hard to adjust
quality of food and hygiene initially, but you'll soon find that the newfound
om of expression dominates all else. Slowly, terms like Hostel Spirit,
iding, and wingmates will make their way into your daily lingo. For the fans of
Bic ni chore, yes, inter-hostel GCs are very accurately represented. For the fans of

TA his second home of yo ves you a lot of leniency in making your decisions.
4 stay res ‘ul and kind to others, and keep a check on yous

  

A lot of you might have already decided where you want to be in life, and a lot
of you have no clue about where you can even be. Don't vom
College is that threshold where linearity stops being inherently built in your life.
No two people have the same path. Looking around, this might you a bad
case of existential crisis, or as we like to call it - BT.
Itis okay to take your time and try out new things. Even if you've made up your _._ __
mind, there's no harm in seeing what the world here has to offer.
Run, Crash, Burn, but at the end of the day (or night or noon or evening), get, )
3 up and give yourself the space to dream again.

4 ae | € 4

Inception 2023 | 08

Adjusting
to Hostel Life:

Drive Slowly: Beautiful Beginnings Ahead

Hey, you're finally here. You've made it! (or so you
think). Your hostel (and your single relationship
status) remains the same throughout your tenure at
IT. This may seem like a big deal, but trust us; you will
soon only let someone change it over only your dead
body.

This will be your respite, home (centre of
suspicious activities), whichever way you slice it, it will
be Ground Zero.

As you valiantly trot forward on your JEE horse, the
lionhearted jump from the mountain of parental love
and mollycoddling at home to the depths of the
bareboned room and _  =hostel might seem
insurmountable. Fret not, however, gallant warriors;
the angels from heaven (us, duh) have deemed onto
you the scroll of truth to guide you through this
arduous journey.

Let Them have cake! (or a healthier
option, please)

You'll soon realise how hard it is to live healthy in
hostels. Breakfast becomes elusive, any motivation to
get up in the morning being flushed away along with
your willingness to maintain a basic diet. Maggi
becomes a constant meal as the hot noodles numb
the hunger brewing after missing two meals in a row.
Fruits become Haleys comet in your meals, once
every 74 years, with constant self-manipulation of
“Shakes count as fruits.” And along with this perfectly
unhealthy diet comes the understanding of money as
a substance. Any prior promises of being responsible
with your money go down the drain in the face of the
sparkling new independence to do whatever you
want.

    

09 | Inception 2023

m,

Yeh Dosti, Ham Kabhi Na Todenge

Before you get accustomed to it, the lackadaisical
ways in which your seniors survive in the hostel will
intimidate (read disgust) you. You will see a dire lack
of hygiene you didnt know was possible. You will see
people who spend more time in others’ rooms than
their own, not understanding the concept of privacy
(or simply, door locks). You'll see people not leaving
their rooms for days, slogging for a good grade
throughout the semester. The common room will be
nothing more than a myth, with the seniors hogging
every available inch of that comfortable paradise.
You will definitely notice one thing in common among
all these types of people. The unbreakable bond,
forged through the endless rants about courses,
banda/ bandi gossip, 3 AM *cough cough* “talks”,
among countless other shared activities(GPL).

The
camaraderie here will be unmatched, with your
college friends ending up as your best friends for life.

iy

™—

—

 

Go hand in hand, You and Enthu!

Yes, you could find it difficult to fit in initially, but soon
the hostel will become a new home, a place of
solidarity and comfort for you. The endearing friends
you make, and the helpful seniors you meet will
together make your college experience like no other.
You'll win together and celebrate together, lose
together and come back stronger together. That first
podium among many will serve as a testament to
your glory days, which you'll cherish years down the
line as you lay down and open the book of memories.
You'll helm the legacy of your hostel and carry it
forward(The cultus will be overenthusiastic about
this- “Is baar BRCA trophy hamari hogi!"), all while
remembering that you didn't even have any of this a
short time ago! These four or five years will surely be
an emotional rollercoaster, and you've just got to
hang on tight.

   

 

Epa
Epa

With great freedom, comes great

homesickness

No matter how much the movies about hostels have
prepared you, nothing but time will accustom you to
the sheer longingness for home and your family.
Staying away from those who were your entire world
is hard, and the task can feel unachievable when you
just want to hug your family. At times like these, the
hugs of your friends, though not the same, can be just
as comforting. The echoing laughter at three at night
when you all are just joking around, the little
adventures with your friends to explore some
unknown corner of the campus, though, may not cure
homesickness but will make you fall in love with your
new home outside of home.

 

} We've got to celebrate
our differences ‘}

1200 entrants from around the country definitely
mean one thing- Diversity- of thoughts,
cultures, beliefs and actions. You and your
roommate(s) might find each other to be polar
opposites, but that's the beauty of it- making

things work, holding your own while
simultaneously being considerate and
understanding. Having a roommate will
prepare you for some things that were

otherwise alien to you. Once you build a rapport
with them, it will be smooth sailing(Apart from a
few gossip sessions, ofcourse).

Compatibility is
not something that everyone has a natural
knack for, so developing it will be necessary to
harmonise with people around you.

Buckle Upguckaroo!

Though it mightynet féel that way yet, but no matter
how much.you, ery, over mess food or the sharing of
rooms or the lack of hygiene, you wouldn't want to
change your hostel life to be any other way. So,
buckle up, probably with deodorants and roont
fresheners and get ready for four or five memorable
(to put it lightly) years of your life —~——~—
eae -—

i,
at “

a® THINGS TO TRY OUT

b BEFORE YOU BOW OUT

Oi

BRCA CLUBS

 

lf you're one of those who crave responsibility and do not shy away from it, you will have the chance
to make a meaningful contribution in various verticals when Rendezvous and Tryst roll around. For
the uninitiated (in other words, those living under a rock), Rendezvous and Tryst are the two biggest
fests organized in IIT Delhi. They are completely organized by students, meaning that being part of
the organizing team will give you priceless insights into event and people management.

+ New Chat

After the mind Ree oe long JEE prep and a criminally short break, you 1 1
would have sworn off studying, But before diving face-first inte that Student Of

the Year experience, realise the importance of maintaining @ sattl. A CGPA

below 7 net only prevents you from helding any PORs, but it also adversely

affects any opportunities you receive in the future, be it placements or

internships.

People with CG below this benchmark have undoubtedly achieved

excellence, but crosstr q this barrier makes life much easier,

at's that smell? Freedom. It is undoubtedly alluring to rebel

and action, so.as our last funda, we won't back down fram acknowledging
culture involving smoking, drinking, bullying, brancnism etc: But remember,
some habits become super hard to weed out. We ur ge you to hee fram
them as much as possible: Peer pressure is rarely healthy whe IE-ccomes Ta
this, as these habits not only get in the way of truly anisting college
experiences. but also put your academics in a precarious position: So we
deepen our voice for our final “Saayvydhan Rahe, Satark Rahe"

While social media and movies have romanticised Delhi, not everything about
the city is aesthetic, and its poor safety and security situation, reflected by
statistics, cannot be brushed aside. We know vole full-of enthu, and your
inner Dora has ambitious plans of exploration with Triends, but always stay
diert while doing so and exercise an air of caution, Additionally, you. may
become habituated to roaming around campus all night but doing so outside,
post-midnight, may not be such a good ide:

Remember all the IIT friendship stories we watched in 3 Idiots and Chichore ?
Dent worry: this. ane is tru unlike the other preconceived notions weve

busted. Your friends will drastically influence your college life, so make the right
connections. We encourage you to try interacting with new people, even those
with whom you do not share interests, because it helps increase your hebaor
and, at the very least, it erable: you to help you broaden your perspective. We
understand that it may be difficult for some, and different people: have
different social requirements; some may like to be in large social groups, while
others may prefer a few good friends, so do not feel pressured and do what
suits you best.

ae Ge Yt forget to interact with seniors who may significantly
help-you, Afterwards, you will make friends and memories that will last you a
ifetime.

d Fresher

Acads, sports, clubs and friends, we know you want to do it-all, but you only have 24 hours
in a day, right? Since you have just broken free from the shackles of JEE, some of you
may Sacrifice academic work to make time for things you missed out on but don't
Missed labs are very hard to compensate for. Submitting assignments past the deadline/
skipping thern will harm your grades and missing classes will rnake you fall behind
mounting pressure on you during exam season, Prioritise your tasks and dant fall into a
vicious cycle of FOMO [Don't do ECA's for the sake of it; partying and being in a
relationship are not the only ways of ‘having a life’), While it may seem overwhelming
initially, managing your time: will go along way in making your IIT journey successful

DisCo;-shert for Disciplinary Committee, is about as fun'as the full form sounds. You
would have heard it in a sentence, with fear riddled in even the most machau seniors
voice, saying, “Bhai uski cheating pe DisCo lag gayil". Short-sighted acts of rebellion and
rule-breaking are met with this dire ultimatum, with a DisCe seriously affecting your
prospects, so take them seriously,

Ina bid to doit all

and sleep to do it. While it may seem beneficial kes you
drowsy during the day and compensating for it in classes a ersely affects your
academics. Going to the mess and eating may seem like a task(yes, the food isn't home-like,
but stil), but skipping meals is a strict no-no. Night messes and canteens would be cheap
alternatives IF you missed a meal. Many of ‘you living alone for the first time may find
maintaining hygiene challenging so you can reach out to: your friends and seniors. Your
mental health is equally important, and you can reach out to friends, seniors and coun:

for help without the fear of being judged or labelled.

Health is wealth, so take care of It.

our journey at IIT Delhi
Even though lIT has given you a great platform, managing academics, participating in sports
and club activities while maintaining mental and physical health and being socially active on
a somewhat ruthless campus is an exciting challenge, and you will have to work hard, There

Vwi

Will be: some tough days but learn from your mistakes and remember that you have a whole
army of babloos, mentors, reps and friends by your side. Find out what's best for you,
positive; and don't give up!

PEOPLE YOU WILL MEET

 

These are the 4th year UG/PG/PhD students whom
you will be meeting in tutorial classes and exams. They
fill the gaps between you and the professors.
Whenever you are not comfortable asking anything
from professors, teaching assistants are the people
you should contact. Tip: Have good relations with your
TA and never shy from asking doubts.

* “a
ee eee

As the name suggests, they are academic mentors assigned to help
with any and all academic problems you might be facing. These
seniors have aced the course they are mentoring and can help you
with your doubts. They carry out regular meetings and doubt-
solving sessions as part of the BSW Academic Mentorship
Programme. They will be the ones you will be looking towards near

S

ha

Not very confident about your English or Hindi?
Don't worry, your language mentors will help you
get it right. Assigned by BSW, the language mentors
ensure you can understand and communicate in

English/Hindi without any hitches. *

 

 
 
 

™

A

Bi

    
  

i 1

é

your minors/majors for the last day's doubts.

Feel free to reach out

to them in case of any queries without hesitation.

 

- =

@ ®
Your mentor is the third/fourth-year senior (generally from the
same branch and hostel) you will interact with mostly apart
from your babloos. They will be the person you can contact in
any problem in any domain of your life. From discussing
courses to discussing clubs or sports, you can contact him for a
one-stop solution. Your mentor also comes out to be your
savior in many bts you will be having with your seniors or
authorities, so feel free to contact them for any issue in your
IIT life. Over the year, you will develop a very strong bond with

your mentor and co-mentees. Also, remember to ask him/her
for a party whenever you meet him/her.

 

The first pair of seniors you will interact with are the BSW
representatives(nobody knows why they are called babloos),
who will warmly welcome you and say, "We are not your
Bhaiya-Didi; we are your Sir/Ma'am.” They are always there
for you in any situation, so never hesitate to ask them for
guidance. They will organize entertaining activities, ice-
breakers, inter-hostel interactions, etc for you in the year(Tip:
try not to miss them). You can always ask them for advice, no
matter how minor your problem seems, they'll always be there
to support you.
Mi‘;

17 | Inception 2023

Once the lockdown period is over, you can find friendly club
reps every second day on your doors eager to share, “Chalo,
chalo abhi ek chhoti si workshop hai, ek event aa raha hai and
usme apni hostel spirit dikhani hai.” They are sophomores
who are your POCs (points of contact) for different clubs.
They have actively contributed to their respective clubs in
their first year. If you want any information or fundae
regarding any club, you should contact the respective reps of
the club(Tip: actively contribute to the club you feel
passionate about to improve your overall college experience)

Ra

Always there and forever asking for an ID card is how
you can sum up your interactions with LHC guards! Be it
8 AM or 5 PM, they care about only your ID, and one
often wonders how they check thousands of students
every day.

What else are they passionate about?
Ensuring everyone knows the correct entry and exit
gates of LHC! If you ever exit through the entry gate or
vice versa, you shall receive a side-eye and trust me, no
one likes those!

ANI

  
 

 

 

bOobEb

This will be the first website you access
using the credentials received in the

welcome email from |IITD. Remember the
password for this (it's different from your
Kerberos credentials), as all the admission
forms are available on this website. All the
fees and mess dues are to be paid here;
keep checking this reqularly to avoid paying
late fines.

Arguably the most helpful website, BSW's
website is the most valuable resource panel
for all your first-year courses. You'll find past
year tutorial sheets and solutions, old majors
and minors as part of their freshie resources
tab. In addition, you'll find Careers and
Placements information and guides to set up
things like your email and internet. This is the
one-stop solution for all your ‘Getting
Started’ and ‘One day before exam’ woes. Be
sure to go through this site thoroughly!

This is the heart of all the websites at /IT DB;
every website at IIT D can be accessed here,
the ‘For Students” section being the most
important. It also connects you to all the
departmental websites. Wanna know the
semester schedule? How about checking on
updates on events and research happening
at IITD? The home website gives you all this
information and more. Do spend time
exploring this absolute gem of a website!

Gradescope:

Gradescope is the website for your MTL and
COL evaluations; you will scan your answer
sheets, see your evaluated scripts and
submit scores of regqrade requests here. The
evaluation completion mail usually makes
you skip a beat if you haven't blasted the
test to shreds. Be careful not to submit
‘frivolous’ regrade requests, as you can lose
marks.

© ONLINEPORTALS

   

  
 

I Your Crulz 1-MML
has been graded IM

°

 

Moodle is an online learning system that
many instructors use to upload notes, course
slides, homework and (in some dire cases)
quizzes. Some professors may also utilise the
platform to make announcements such as
class schedules or course policies.

Thus,
always be on the lookout for updates on this
space! On opening the IITD Moodle page,
youre welcomed with a deceptively simple
captcha system which will permanently have
you questioning your ability to do questions
like ‘69-83 to verify you're human:
downloading an auto-captcha may end up
saving a lot of your time (and mental sanity)!

Webmail. iitd.ac.in:

 

—
————=
—
—>
O

 
  
   

This website will likely be the most visited site
in your browser after joining IIT. The IITD
webmail is the official communication
channel at IIT and connects you with fellow
students, professors and staff. It can be
accessed using your Kerberos ID (which you
will receive using Scorner). All updates about
quizzes, extra classes, orientations, webinars,
application deadlines, tutorials and, of course,
BSP’s monthly TLDR newsletter about campus
happenings are sent via Webmail. Remember
to organise your Webmail and be updated, or
you will find yourself missing APL and MTL
quizzes!

Mm Bh. MN RY

SS

You type in your username and password with
a pounding heart and shaking hands. As the
page unfolds, there are the grades you've
been working hard towards all year. This portal
does more than record your grades; it also
keeps tabs on your co-curricular and fee
records. It will also be where you can find
Courses Of Study and essential updates. You
can also register for courses in your
sophomore year on this website. Remember to
get yourself VPN access from the CSC if you
want to access Moodle or Eacads while not on
campus!

LSONS OF
HTD cow

"BHAIYA NHI MUJHE SIR. BULAO”

So how do you ensure the emotional safety of supposedly innocent
freshers as they transition from their homely comfort to the playing field
called college? The administration has made tried-and-tested
arrangements for the same. The idea is to restrict the interaction
between freshers and seniors for the first month, along with entry and exit
timings in hostels. It's always fun to see wide-eyed, confused fachhe
search for elusive lecture halls and decipher the mysteries of college life,
though, so we ain't complaining. We are totally prepared for a bunch of
direction-seeking, over-enthusiastic wanderers on campus, especially
near Chaayos!

 

"KITNE PYQS KAR LIYE?’

As the mental vacuum (or serene bliss, if you like it that way) created
by the lack of academic pressure following years of countless JEE
mock tests finally draws to a close, people become hyperconscious
and go back to their jee-mode, seeking academic validation via the
MTLIOO quiz. New bonds are formed as students are introduced to
group study. Many students, and perhaps you too (if you are tangled
up in the depC matrix) may tend to judge others solely on the basis of
this quiz’s grade. However, we suggest you take a more mature
approach, for this quiz will seldom be talked about ever again.

"WHAT DO YOU MEAN PRONITE DOBARA aNd
CANCEL HO GYI”” uN

Buckle up for fest time at IITD—it's a wild roller coaster ride!

Ambushed by Rendezvous, Tryst, Literati, and much more, get ready to unleash
your inner party animal and spam your Instagram accounts with aesthetic
pictures because this fest season will make your head spin in the most fabulous
way possible. Rest assured that your school friends will be hella jealous.

Cheers to
the craziest time of your life! However, take a moment or two to acknowledge the
substantial effort it takes on behalf of the CTMs, activity heads, club
representatives, and many others who scarcely ever get the spotlight.

 

 

23 | Inception 2023

 

"BAS SATTI AA JAYE YAAR”

Buckle up, brave souls, for within the hallowed halls of IIT Delhi lies a sinister
realm known as the major Exam Season, where sleepless nights, caffeine-
induced tremors, and crumbling sanity intertwine in a dark comedy that tests
the limits of human endurance. As the clock ticks away, the desperate
performers on this academic stage juggle formulas, theories, and last-minute
prayers for divine intervention.

Students transform into nocturnal creatures fueled by caffeine and fear. The
library turns into a graveyard of sanity, where sleep-deprived souls wander in
desperation. As dawn breaks, they stumble into the LHC, their minds a delicate
mixture of knowledge and delirium. When faced with seemingly impossible
questions, a peculiar art form emerges - creative guesswork. Equipped with a
pen and a tinge of madness, students summon their inner Picasso, crafting
creative answers that dance on the fine line between genius and utter nonsense.
Students emerge from their exam halls like battle-scarred warriors, sharing tales
of heroic attempts and epic failures. Laughter fills the air, mingling with sighs of
relief and the bittersweetness of survival. So grab your popcorn, folks, because
Majors are the most incredible comedy show you ever signed up for!

= —s

”ACHA HAI IS BAAR ZYADA POLTU NHI

Kl HUI HOSTEL MAIN”

Welcome to the enigmatic world of IIT Delhis politics, where the hostel
representatives of various clubs and the clandestine hostel secretaries rise to
power. You will be sure to see seniors rushing to secure votes, boasting (seldom
truthfully) about the work they did in their previous tenure, and bribing you with
PORs. The stakes are high, and merit might not always be the deciding factor, but
worry not, for you will be sure to witness a captivating flow of democracy.

«TUSSI JA RAHE HO, TUSSI NA JAQ? Wie. y)

As Dickens aptly put it, They were the best of times, they were the worst of times.
The fourth-year batch leaving is a bittersweet event, to say the least.

As they take
on diverse roads in life, they tearily bid goodbye to their peers-the maggus, the
homies, even the saanps and get a million pictures clicked for the worth of a
lifetime. But hey! What does all this mean to you? Though we sincerely hope that
you were able to connect emotionally, if not, then at least don't miss out on the
festivities. From awesome DJ nights, prize distribution ceremonies, and cultural
performances to mouth-watering dishes, we have you covered. Here’s another
little secret: inter-hostel movement is allowed for a day.

FIRST-YEAR

The stuff they teach you go from 0 to

100 real quick.

Last week you were having

a recap of JEE Matrices, and then
suddenly, you’re thrown all these Vector
Spaces, Subspaces, Basis, and Dimensions.
It then turns to the more disturbing part
of the Differential Equation, which
involves lots of transformation and
resembles nothing of what one might've
learned in their 12th. Like MTL100, being
attentive in class and focusing on building
conceptual understanding is the mantra to
excel in this course.

ELP101

This course will require you to apply your
understanding of the concepts learned in
ELL101. It is generally a relaxed and
enjoyable course, and you may even
develop a liking for it as you experience
the satisfaction of seeing things function
as intended. Submit reports on time while
following the guidelines outlined in the
rubric.

Inception 2023 | 30

 

  

S@ COUNCILS

ecause we do more than just study!

The Student Affairs Council is the apex student body of IIT Delhi and oversees
all non-academic student affairs on campus. It is responsible for maintaining
/, the student welfare, ensuring a conducive and healthy environment for the
holistic development of students. It recognises five boards - BSW, BSP, BSA,
BRCA, and BHM, each of which is responsible for a different facet of student
life. SAC aspires to be a transparent body and welcomes regular feedback and
suggestions from students. Any student may reach out to SAC via their
respective hostel representatives. The SAC website also furnishes minutes of
the meetings, new policies, and other information pertaining to student
/ welfare and representation.

 

 
  
   
 
 
    
     
      

CO-CURRICULAR AND ACADEMIC INTERACTION COUNCIL —//

 

The council serves as a governing body over technical and peacemcy/
organisations while also overseeing a myriad of technical clubs and all /
departmental societies. Its primary function revolves around managing and
regulating these entities. Furthermore, the council plays a pivotal role in
fostering a healthy and comprehensive’ dialogue between students and ))
professors, creating an environment conducive to intellectual exchange. By //
redressing academic grievances, the council maintains a positive academic

space year-round, enabling students to unleash their full potential.
Additionally, the council organises Tryst, one of North India’s largest technical
fests. This event showcases technical prowess and serves as a platform for =\

>
innovation and the recognition of individuals’ talents. Hh \

ae Oop

BRCA is where the pursuit of knowledge harmoniously intertwines with the
spirit of recreation and creativity. Beyond the corridors of academia, IIT Delhi
offers a plethora of engaging activities to enthral your spirits. It oversees the
functioning of the eleven cultural. clubs, each of which offers a unique avenue
for self-expression and personal growth. Thanks to them, exhilarating
competitions, awe-inspiring workshops, and collaborative events can be
executed. Be on the lookout for BRCA Freshers’ Night, where they proudly
introduce themselves and awaken the dormant artist in you.

And don't you dare
miss out on Rendezvous, one of the most-awaited cultural college fests, which
is organised by BRCA:

 

31 | Inception 2023

BOARD FOR SPORTS ACTIVITIES

IT Delhi has a thriving sporting culture thanks to the efforts of the Board for
Sports Activities or BSA. This is the overarching board managing, regulating,
and conducting various sporting events throughout the year. It conducts trials
for 13 different sports, maintains equipment, and caters to the sportspeople on
campus! The board organises an annual sports fest - Sportech which sees
active participation from various institutes. Moreover, the much-revered inter- -

hostel sports championship - General Championship or GC is conducted by // /
BSA. The board is sustained by a number of executives, coordinators, vice- U4,
captains, and captains at multiple levels.

 

  
   
    

// = BOARD FOR STUDENT PUBLICATIONS

47 Yup! That's us — the official student-run digital and print media body of IIT Delhi.

We work endlessly so that you are updated with the latest happenings on
f campus, from cultural events to technical breakthroughs. We publish a series of
—~ magazines: Inception (for the overwhelmed fresher), Elemental (for the
~ technologically curious), and Muse (for the creative escapist). We are
- responsible for newsletters that analyse problems faced at campus with a
down-to-earth approach. On the lighter side, we explore the non-academic side
of professors, collect fundae from machau seniors.and efficiently disseminate

magazine making competition, and Literati - the annual literary fest for the lover
of language and literature among you!

BOARD FOR STUDENT WELFARE

BSW is responsible for facilitating the welfare of the students on campus. The
board has two divisions: operations and mentorship. It has a number of
effective programs such as language mentorship (for students who wish to
hone their English language), acad mentorship (for help in first-year courses by
seniors), and the mentorship program (for incoming freshers). Campus tours
and events like Delhi Darshan are also organised by BSW to make for pleasant — ,
beginnings for freshers! Watch out for internship and placement fundae, |/
seminars, and last-minute revision sessions to make your life a little easier. BSW
also takes care of sustained student health by spreading awareness about
mental health and counselling platforms like SCS, YourDost, etc.

BSW
representatives are among the first seniors you will interact with on campus.

 

ted BOARD FOR HOSTEL MANAGEMENT

/¢ BHM is the only board that touches the life of every student every single day!
‘’ They are responsible for operating and maintaining the hostel messes and other

- amenities for students around the campus. You can reach out to your BHM
representative to complain (read: rant) about food quality or leaking taps. BHM
is maintained by a maintenance and mess secretary at the hostel-level who
releases a new mess menu roughly each month. They also work closely with the
administration to bring you new facilities such as the newly opened Udaigiri
night mess! So, count on BHM, to: deliver quick and effective solutions to your
boarding and gastronomical problems on campus!

Infinity Hyperloop Club

Do you envision a future where high-speed travel inside a vacuum-sealed pod-becomes a reality? Are you
someone who dreams about being part of the technological revolution.in-transport? If yes, then Infinity Hyperloop
is the club for you!

This dedicated team has been developing hyperloop technology which was first introduced by Elon Musk. Its
mission is to create a fully functioning hyperloop pod prototype.

It has already developed a fully functioning Linear 4
Tiel te peeled Madge Me Me Met] ect es (W]e cam Cee [et gv M Ug ase = che =a Cede Ce oa
existing information, creates its own technologies, and participates in many national and international
competitions like the European Hyperloop Week, which makes learning yet more fun. The club is driven by an
unwavering zeal to transform this mode of transportation into a reality not only in India but also across the world. If
you wish to contribute to the future of transportation, you can join any of the sub-departments and be a part of
this exciting and innovative project. The recruitment process typically happens during the summer break, so be on
the lookout for it. You can also visit the RNI park on campus to see the cool work environment.

RENDEZVOUS be

Rendezvous, the annual fest at IIT Delhi, is an unparalleled experience that words
cannot accurately capture. It surpasses expectations year after year, leaving attendees
with unforgettable memories. This four-day extravaganza offers a wide range of events
in dance, drama, debate, photography, music, literature, and more, catering to diverse
interests. The campus is adorned with marvelous decorations, creating a vibrant
atmosphere. The highlight of Rendezvous is the Pronites, featuring extravagant
concerts and awe-inspiring performances by renowned artists like Benny Dayal and
Sunidhi Chauhan. With a legacy of greatness, RDV23 promises to.be even bigger and
better, drawing youth from all over the country.

It's an event you simply cannot miss.

innovate, and explore more nerdy goodness thah you-can Code in a lifetime. We've got competitions
that'll make your circuits sizzle! Picture robot competitions with you screaming, "Activate the robot
uprising!" Plus, hackathons where sleep is for the weak, and Auto Expo and Startup Expo to satisfy
your inner entrepreneur. And if that's not enough, we've got guest lectures by genius minds and
workshops to tickle your fancy. And there's more Laser Tag battles, heart-pounding gaming
contests—you name it, we've got it! a”
So, strap on your propeller hats and join us at Tryst, the geek's paradise, where dreams become —
code and laughter becomes binary. Don't be a square, my friend. This is where eam (ele ale st te

This’

%

The GC (General Championship) culture at IIT is more than just a spirited tradition om
—it's a competitive arena where students showcase their talents and embrace i
challenges with determination.

In the realm of GC, students form alliances, representing their hostels with pride. q »

They engage in a friendly clash of talents across various domains, pushing their |
limits to achieve victory.

It's a vibrant atmosphere where students strive to excel ;
and grow. “
The GC culture at IIT celebrates the underdogs who rise to the occasion, inspiring
their peers with their resilience and achievements. During the GC season, the

campus buzzes with energy and ambition as students refine their skills and

pursue excellence.

Beyond the battles and rivalries, the GC culture at IIT fosters camaraderie and

friendship. It teaches students that success is earned through hard work and

dedication, and setbacks are met with resilience, serving as stepping stones

towards future triumphs.

The GC culture at IIT is a reminder that success encompasses not only y

 

achievements but also the bonds formed, the lessons learned, and the joy shared
along the way. It showcases the diverse talents and unwavering spirit of IIT
students, leaving a lasting impact on their college experience. ain

 

4] | Inception 2023

 

Mittal sports Com plex: Enjoy state-of-
the-art facilities for indoor sports, including Squash,
Badminton, Table tennis, and Chess, at the heart of sports at
IIT Delhi. Get ready for thrilling indoor sports action!

 

Squash at IIT Delhi: Equip yourself with a racket, step onto the court, and embrace the
captivating world of squash at SAC and the Mittal. Get ready for intense rallies and a
thrilling squash experience!

Tennis at IIT Delhi: Serve up a smashing tennis experience on meticulously 8 maintained
courts - both clay and hard, with coaching facilities for all skill levels. Grab a racket, rally
with fellow tennis enthusiasts, and dominate the court!

Badminton at IIT Delhi: Experience thrilling rallies and powerful smashes on well-
maintained courts at SAC and Mittal, surrounded by skilled players and a vibrant
badminton community. Grab a racket and unleash your badminton skills!

Football at IIT Delhi: Score goals on a magnificent football ground located in the heart of
the campus, and unleash your passion for the game ina thrilling environment. Lace up your
shoes and be a football superstar!

Volleyball at IIT Delhi: Set, spike, and serve your way to victory on practice courts including
a sandy volleyball court. With coaching and summer camps, become a volleyball legend and
feel the thrill of the game!

Cricket at IIT Delhi: Join the cricketing glory with intense matches on a world-class pitch,
guided by dedicated coaches and summer camps, and experience the camaraderie of a
passionate community.

Step onto the field and become a cricket champion!

Weightlifting at IIT Delhi: Power up at well-equipped gyms in SAC and each hostel, join
the competitive buzz, and witness your strength developing firsthand. Prepare to lift,
challenge your limits, and become a weightlifting powerhouse!

Chess at IIT Delhi: Unleash your intellectual prowess in weekly tournaments, learn from pro
players and coaches, and indulge in the addictive thrill of its vibrant community. It's time to
make your moves and master the 64 squares!

Swimming at IIT Delhi: Dive into excellence with well-maintained pools at SAC, qualified
coaches, and a focus on physical fitness and mental well-being. Get ready to make a splash
and unleash your swimming skills - but beware of Delhi's winter season when the pools are
shut.

Inception 2023 | 42

 

BEING

[No, not the one associated with the famous Bollywood Actor]

Your life at IIT Delhi is much more than academics. Between leveraging yourself to greater heights,
and balancing extracurriculars with acads, look around and try to be human. You will always be
proud of the impact you've caused and the ecosystem you've helped build. These are a few of IIT Del-
hi's offerings for you to grow into a better individual.

National Service Scheme-

NSS IIT Dethi is the IIT Delhi chapter of the National Service Scheme, institutionalized under
the Ministry of Youth Affairs & Sports Govt. of India. Our sole aim is to motivate students at
ITD to indulge in nation-building activities through various events and projects which are
aimed towards the benefit of people in and around IIT Delhi. NSS conducts periodical
collection drives as well. This is a very impact-oriented and welfare-driven organisation. You
will meet some of the kindest seniors and Professors here. NSS hosts an annual fest ‘Kaizen’,
which celebrates social endeavors and personalities pan India.

Enactus-

A global socio-entrepreneurial organisation, Enactus is the best of both worlds. (Ever imagined
Scrooge McDuck helping set out village infrastructure? Time to get onto that Midjourney API!)
Enactus IIT Delhi is the right place to learn firsthand about business and starting up.

Their
projects are focused on creating an equitable world, while simultaneously utilising tools like
design thinking, unit economics, distribution laws, business plans, et cetera.

Enactus has a very relaxed hierarchy where-in you call your seniors by their name. It is
subdivided into various Projects and Divisions like- Jhabua, Daksha, PlanetLabs, Funding and
Finance, Events and Outreach.

P.S- These are a bunch of very hardworking and tight-knit folk. Their recruitment process, akin to that of BSP. is
extremely exhaustive and fun!

P.PS.- Answer any and all questions in their orientation, you'll be flooded with chocolates. :)

Blood Connect-

An NGO started right in the halls of IIT Delhi, this organisation has helped save close to 4 lakh
lives since its inception in 2010. India is a blood-deficient nation, which, however, can be
mitigated to a large extent by voluntary blood donation, This is where BCT comes in, Volunteers
and team-leads help conduct helplines, awareness sessions, blood donation camps, funding ses-
sions, health checkups, et cetera. Working with BCT is immensely fulfilling and directly contrib-
utes to the welfare of society. BloodConnect organises camps on most major festivals and na-
tional holidays. In its heyday, BloodConnect even had a fest of its own!

PS- Rumour has it that no member of BloodConnect has less than 150 NSS hours on clock. Make of that what

you willl

43 | Inception 2023

HUMAN

NRVCEE- \

The National Resource Centre for Value Education in Engineering (NRCVEE) was established with
the motto, “Integrity without knowledge is weak and useless, but knowledge without integrity is dangerous
and dreadful". Its fundamental missions include undertaking research to understand human
potential and well-being, rendering evidence-based findings with both micro and macro level
implications and developing techniques which motivate engineers and students to imbibe
human values and appreciate their impact on technology development.

NRCVEE conducts
seminars, workshops, and meditation events on campus, as a result of which students get to
meet a lot of IIT Delhi professors and alumni so even if you're not so interested in tech, do
give it a go because who knows, you might just get that boost you've been looking for your
influencer career through a podcast with Amol Parashar!

AINA-

The formation of AINA, An Initiative for National Advancement, was inspired by the conviction of
a small group of volunteers from IIT Delhi who believed that the world's peril did not arise
from the actions of malicious people, but rather from the absence of the proactive
involvement of a few virtuous ones. AINA has three popular activities that it organises across
the year-

1. Swadesh is an opportunity to work for the people living in the rural areas in different parts
of this country.

2. Manthan is a discussion on various socio-philosophical topics and values revolving around
a student's life.

3. Srijan is a weekly trip to the slums of Munirka for the holistic development and education
of the children present there.

This academic year, AINA also hosted Sahbhoj, a community engagement programme
involving a food collection drive culminating into a collective feast of Dal Chawal in Munirka.

IRSC-

The Indian Road Safety Campaign (IRSC) originated as a project within the National Service
Scheme at IIT Delhi, in response to the tragic loss of students' lives in-a road accident.
Determined to prevent further tragedies, a team of students and faculty initiated the
campaign with the goal of making Indian roads safer. Under the guidance of the Transport
Research and Injury Prevention Program, the campaign has grown into-a youth-led mission,
supported by students from colleges nationwide (10 states and 50+ cities). As-an initiative
of SOLVE (pun intended), a trust established by IIT Delhi students and alumni to solve ground
level societal problems, IRSC strives to reduce road accidents by half before 2030 through
comprehensive measures addressing awareness, infrastructure, and emergency response.

inception 2023 | 44

  

   

IGES - Initiative for Gender
Equity and Sensitisation

   
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
   
 

IGES is the gender initiative and support cell of IIT Delhi, and it was
announced officially in March 2018 on the occasion of International
Women's Day.

Gender is something you experience and is not limited
to being a man ora woman; this idea is rooted deeply in the initiatives
taken by IGES. They aim to be a non-judgmental and safe space for
students, staff, and faculty members to allow them to share their
thoughts, concerns, anxieties, incidents, or even dilemmas related to
their gender and sexuality. They also provide social support directly or
through referrals (confidentiality is always maintained).

This group also organises film screenings, thematic discussions and
debates, and many other events to create awareness. Moreover,
workshops for gender awareness and the prevention of sexual
harassment are regularly conducted for all cohorts of the institute
community. IGES also promotes conversations with multiple
stakeholders to understand the gender-related challenges restricting
an individual's access, career, and leadership in STEM fields. The aim is
to mainstream gender and equity perspectives in the institute's vision,
planning, and day-to-day ae

ICE- Initiative for Caste Equity oS
on

IIT Delhi is committed to a friendly, discrimination- free and Li)
unbiased environment for everyone. Initiative for Caste Equity Lo
(ICE) is responsible for educating the campus community about faa
the significance of equality and diversity in building an equitable wn
environment. @
2

The main purpose of the ICEis to ensure that no one is
discriminated against on the basis of caste. As a policy, the
category status of the students, i.e., SC/ST/OBC/EWS/Gen,
should not be disclosed in the hostel or the classroom. The entire
student community resides and dines together. A senior faculty
member is appointed as an advisor to SC/ST students to advise
them on academic and non-academic matters.

Office of D

ICE also organises various outreach programmes like seminars,
workshops, film screenings, plays and discussions on caste
privileges, discrimination, and awareness.

In addition, it
conducts mock interviews for final year SC/ST students to help
with their placements, strengthens coordination between the
work of the SC/ST Liaison Officer and the Student Advisor
and connects with SC/ST cells of other IITs.

45 | Inception 2023

Indradhanu

Indradhanu-the LGBTQIA+ collective at IIT Delhi under the
Office of Diversity & Inclusion (ODI) that aims to make the
campus more inclusive, one rainbow ata time.

Their mission is to raise awareness about the beauty of
gender and sexual minorities. Indradhanu helps create a
safe space for everyone to explore, socialise, and learn
together, surrounded by love and acceptance.

They collaborate with the bigwigs at the institute to shape
policies that respect and protect LGBTQIA-+ rights.
Indradhanu is one of India's largest Student- driven Queer
Collectives, with more than 215+ members. On the national
stage, itis a part of the Pan IIT petitioners' group that chal-
lenged the constitutional validity of Indian Penal Code 377
(a provision that criminalised homosexuality).
indradhanu endeavours to make IIT Delhi strive toward the
intersectional causes of social justice, equality, and
freedom. They hosted the first IIT All India Queer Collective
Conference during Vibhinn (IIT Delhi's Pride Festival) 2023.

The ITD community in-

This diversity

diversity present on

create an inclusive envi-

feels safe and welcome.

 

 

OAE - Office of
Accessible Education

   

The Office of Accessible Education (OAE) caters to the FON
needs of persons with disabilities in order to create an
environment where everyone can Succeed and contribute

to the best of their abilities. Some individuals face unique
challenges and barriers in their daily activities. OAE identifies
and addresses these barriers, allowing them to participate
fully in educational activities to make their journey atliT Delhi
comfortable and hassle-free, Special assistance

varying from academics to infrastructure requirements is
taken care of by the department.

.

The services provided by OAE include assistive technology
resources (Hardware and Software), study material in an
accessible format, scribe and compensatory time,

e- Rikshaw and wheelchair facility for moving across the IITD
campus and training of various assistive technologies.

© SCHOLARSHIPS:

Do you see those videos of students studying independently based on scholarships and want to do the same?

Don't worry; IITD offers many opportunities based on your merit and overall performance here. It provides a tuition fee waiver for students
with a family income less than S LPA. Other than that, we also have Merit-Gum-Means scholarships for students whose family income is up to
4.5 LPA, along with a minimum CGPA of 6.

UG students who are required to pay full tuition fees and have a family income of less than 9LPA
are also eligible for donor-supported MCM scholarships,

The ITD Alumni have always been philanthropic and have funded a broad spectrum of scholarships. The scholarships generally vary,
targeting some set of students; for instance, some scholarships are hostel-wise, some branch-wise, while others are open to all. Big
organisations like Reliance and Tata also offer generous scholarships to students,

? HOW DO | AVAIL?

For some, you'll automatically get selected, like the endowment scholarships (provided you meet all the eligibility criteria), while for others,
you will be required to apply yourself. Always check your ITD webmail, as that would be the primary place where you will be requiarly notified
regarding different scholarships and how to apply for them. For some hostel-wise scholarships, you might get notifications on your
fesse mL Ociisl elle sae arse Ms ee 0) te Orsi \ ete Mig shinee

47 | Inception 2023

 

 

MENTAL HEALTH

The experience of stepping into a completely new world of college
might overwhelm you. As you walk past the doors of your dream
institute, you will be left bewitched by its beauty! The beauty of the
opportunities it throws at you, the new experiences it brings your
way, and the lifelong friends that you make here. But with all the fun
and merry come a few challenges. You might feel lost at times, you
would perhaps feel out of place, or that you are unable to cope with
life and live up to your own expectations. How do we know that?
Because we all have been through the same struggles. Every soul on
campus goes through this rough patch once and many go through it
multiple times. However, what you should know is that this is
completely normal. You may not realize this, but every person around
you is as perplexed as yourself. We're all trying to figure out our lives
because this is what a transition looks like.

 

Here are some of the difficulties you might experience and what you should do to
battle them:

1. Feeling Out of Place

In an institute where the top minds of the country are brought together, you are bound to feel
intimidated at some point. Seeing everyone excel in something or the other might compel you to
doubt your capabilities. But what you need to remember is that you are among those top brains too!
You've made it here after immense hard work and dedication.

You too deserve to be here for you have
come a long way and you shouldn't let anybody bring your self-confidence and faith down!

2. Home-sickness/ Isolation

Not many of us had lived away from our families and friends until this point in time. It is very natural
for you to miss your loved ones and cry for their company. You might as well have a hard time
struggling to make friends but never forget that this phase will pass real quick. You will meet some
amazing people here who will always be on your side and will make your journey memorable. The only
catch here is that this takes time. So just hold on to it until you find your group, just like we all did!

3. Disappointment
It is quite normal for you to feel dejected when things don't turn out your way, when you don't score
as per your expectations, when you fail to make it to your desired clubs, or when the hostel hygiene
gives you nightmares. In times like these, all that you have to remember is that everyone, just like
you, is sailing in the same boat and is facing all these issues. You are not alone and you must embrace
the change with open arms.

In addition to the above-mentioned assurances that you should
think about whenever you find yourself facing a mental block,
IIT Delhi too has got your back. It has some ways planned out
for you that will help you combat these situations. This includes
the BSW Curated Content consisting of fun-filled playlists,
movies, videos, etc. which can be accessed by scanning the QR
code; the counselors present on campus who you can approach
by simply dropping them an email or even ringing up their
phones in case of emergency. Moreover, feel free to reach out
to your mentors for help because they too had experienced all
this and are very well aware of how to overcome such
situations.

 

Inception 2023 | 48

  
    
  

We Rnow that it wouldn't be even a month
here in ITD, and you would be planning
many fun activities with your friends, but
amidst all the fun, drawing a boundary
between what is ethical and what's notis
very important.

As you navigate your confusing life at IIT Dethi,
you would be planning to indulge in many
fun activities, but amidst all the fun, remember
the Code of Honor, which you signed before
joining, and you should be thoroughly familiar
with the repercussions if there is some violation in
code.

Simply put, whenever you try to break the
code, you are in danger of DisCo. Even though the word
itself doesn't give you chills as it should have, DisCo or
Disciplinary Committee is not another badge you want to
acquire.

The effects of DisGo could be pretty majestic, and your college life
would be forever doorned just because of your slightest
misjudgments. The easiest way the prof can punish you is by
messing with your marks, which can impact your CGPA
significantly. You won't be allowed to held any PORs (Position of
Responsibility) in your entire tenure at IIT, which can result in a
blank CV, For freshers, you would be barred from applying for a
DepC or department change, a ubiquitous goal of freshers. Your
aloha e\ me lca MULT e MMMM Mg lce (eat/-0 a0) aTo ye) dmi0) gia i gate mel 0 Ly
hostel facilities can be abandoned throughout your stay here. So,
between all the different avenues you explore, it would be wise to
leave this one stone unturned,

ere all the BRCA clubs showcase their prowess to

their IDs and forcing their way in. The event soon
turned out to be a disaster as this nugatory chaos
soon got into a stampede, ultimately cancelling the
second and even the third-day pronite. Here, the
safety of students was taken as the utmost priority,
which left no choice but to call off the third pronite.
To summarise, ITD prioritises the safety of their
students the most, and any sneaky plans which can
undermine their security will be caught and severely
punished.
